name: handler-implementation-workflow
title: Handler Implementation Workflow - BDD → TDD → Done
description: Complete workflow for implementing new handlers using Test-Driven Development driven by Business-Driven Development specifications
purpose: Guide agents through implementing handlers using BDD→TDD→Done pattern

phases.name: WSJF Prioritization
phases.description: Apply Weighted Shortest Job First scoring to candidate handlers to select the next highest-value smallest slice.

steps.details: Enumerate pending handlers (diagnosis, fix, validation, deploy, learning).
Relative 1-10 scale: user impact, revenue, stability.
Urgency due to deadlines, incidents, seasonal demand.
How much risk is retired or new capability unlocked.
Relative effort (story points or t-shirt sizing mapped to numbers).
Formula: (BV + TC + RR/OE) / JS. Rank descending.
Pick top WSJF AND confirm feasibility for current iteration timeframe.
Append/Update WSJF table in DEMO_FEEDBACK.md or WSJF_DECISIONS.md.

business_bdd_spec.user_story: As a product stakeholder, I want high-value handlers implemented first so that we maximize ROI and agility.

phases.name: Understand Business Requirements
phases.description: Read and understand the business BDD specification for the handler

steps.details: Check existence & freshness of packages/self-healing/.generated/comprehensive-business-bdd-specifications.json; if missing or stale run: node scripts/generate-comprehensive-business-bdd-specs.js
steps.expected_outcome: Specification file present, up-to-date, validated before tests

steps.details: Open packages/self-healing/.generated/comprehensive-business-bdd-specifications.json
steps.expected_outcome: Found handler specification with business context

steps.details: Find handler by name and review: name, sequence, businessValue, persona, scenarios
steps.expected_outcome: Understand what problem the handler solves and who uses it

steps.details: Read Given-When-Then scenarios for realistic business use cases

business_bdd_spec.user_story: As an agent, I want to understand the business requirements so that I implement the handler correctly

scenarios.title: Product Owner verifies spec artifact before implementation
then: workflow can proceed to BDD test implementation

scenarios.title: Agent reads business spec for parseTelemetryRequested
given: handler specification includes business value and persona

phases.name: Implement Business BDD Test
phases.description: Implement the business BDD test with realistic scenarios

steps.details: Open packages/self-healing/__tests__/business-bdd-handlers/[N]-[handler-name].spec.ts
steps.expected_outcome: Test file open with TODO comments

steps.details: Set up realistic production data matching the business scenario
steps.expected_outcome: Preconditions set up with realistic data

steps.details: Execute the handler with the test context
Verify business outcomes (not just technical correctness)
npm test -- __tests__/business-bdd-handlers/[N]-[handler-name].spec.ts
steps.expected_outcome: Test fails (handler doesn't exist yet) - this is expected

steps.details: Ensure all unused variables are prefixed with underscore (_ctx, _result, etc.) to comply with ESLint @typescript-eslint/no-unused-vars rule
steps.expected_outcome: No lint warnings in test file

business_bdd_spec.user_story: As an agent, I want to implement the business BDD test so that I verify business outcomes

scenarios.title: Agent implements business BDD test for parseTelemetryRequested
given: business BDD test file exists with TODO comments
when: agent replaces TODO comments with actual test code
agent sets up realistic production data

phases.name: Implement Unit Tests (TDD - Red)
phases.description: Write failing unit tests (Red phase of TDD)

steps.details: Open packages/self-healing/__tests__/[sequence].spec.ts
steps.expected_outcome: Unit test file open with test stubs

steps.details: Write test for normal successful execution
Write test for error conditions and edge cases
npm test -- __tests__/[sequence].spec.ts
steps.expected_outcome: All tests fail (Red phase) - this is expected

steps.details: Ensure all unused variables are prefixed with underscore (_ctx, _result, etc.) to comply with ESLint @typescript-eslint/no-unused-vars rule
steps.expected_outcome: No lint warnings in test file

business_bdd_spec.user_story: As an agent, I want to write failing unit tests so that I drive implementation with TDD

scenarios.title: Agent writes failing unit tests for parseTelemetryRequested
given: unit test file exists with test stubs

phases.name: Implement Handler (TDD - Green)
phases.description: Implement handler to make tests pass (Green phase of TDD)

steps.details: Create packages/self-healing/src/handlers/[sequence]/[handler-name].ts
Implement: validate input, process, publish events, return results, handle errors
npm test -- __tests__/[sequence].spec.ts
Clean up code for readability, performance, error handling, type safety
npm test -- __tests__/[sequence].spec.ts

business_bdd_spec.user_story: As an agent, I want to implement the handler so that it makes tests pass

phases.name: Verify Business BDD Test
phases.description: Verify business BDD test passes with implemented handler

steps.details: npm test -- __tests__/business-bdd-handlers/[N]-[handler-name].spec.ts
Confirm business outcomes are achieved (not just technical correctness)

business_bdd_spec.user_story: As an agent, I want to verify the business BDD test passes so that I confirm business value

scenarios.title: Agent verifies business BDD test passes

phases.name: Live Demo & Feedback
phases.description: Demonstrate the implemented vertical slice (handler + tests + artifacts) to stakeholders for immediate feedback before expanding scope.

steps.details: Execute runTelemetryParsing, runAnomalyDetection (and runDiagnosisAnalyze when available) in a local script/REPL.
steps.expected_outcome: Console output shows sequence events and summary objects.

steps.details: Open .generated/telemetry-metrics.json and anomalies.json (and diagnosis-results.json when present).
Map outcomes to original business BDD scenarios.
Capture improvement ideas & new edge cases.
Prioritize next handler(s) or refinements.

business_bdd_spec.user_story: As a stakeholder, I want to see a live demo early so that I can provide feedback and ensure alignment.

scenarios.title: Stakeholder watches demo of new handler slice

phases.name: Verify All Tests & Lint
phases.description: Verify all tests pass and lint passes

steps.details: npm test
npm run lint
Get code reviewed by team

business_bdd_spec.user_story: As an agent, I want to verify all tests and lint pass so that code is ready for production

scenarios.title: Agent verifies all tests and lint pass

quality_checklist: Unit tests pass (happy path + error handling)
key_principles: Business-First: Start with business BDD spec
Clean Code: Pure functions, clear error handling, event publishing, type safety
Quality: All tests pass, lint passes, code reviewed

service_objectives.overview: Service Level Objectives (SLOs) define clear performance and reliability targets; Service Level Indicators (SLIs) measure them; SLAs communicate external commitments.

business_values.description: SLO-driven constraints surface scaling needs early enabling modular evolution.
Quantified targets (e.g., latency_p95 <= 300ms) align stakeholders and engineering focus.
Central SLO config JSON becomes single source-of-truth referenced in plugin & sequences.
Automated breach detection feeds anomaly & diagnosis sequences to trigger remediation.
Historical SLI trend + breach analytics fuel WSJF reprioritization and learning models.

slice_demo_expectations: Show current computed SLIs from telemetry artifacts
Display evaluation comparing each SLI vs target
Highlight any breaches as anomaly events
Explain business value mapping for each objective

definition_of_done: WSJF phase completed with decision artifact (WSJF_DECISIONS.md)
Business spec artifact verified or regenerated (Phase 1 step 0) before tests
Orchestrator slice runnable end-to-end (telemetry → anomaly → diagnosis)
Optional packaging tasks succeed (if version bump needed)
CI readiness: test & lint scripts definable for automation
Documentation/workflow file updated to reflect new handlers
No orphaned TODOs in implemented slice
Ready for next WSJF prioritization cycle
lint_requirements: Prefix unused variables with underscore: _ctx, _result, _error (ESLint rule: @typescript-eslint/no-unused-vars requires /^_/u pattern)
All test files must follow this pattern to avoid lint warnings
Example: const _ctx = createTestContext(); // unused but required for test setup
